result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Francis Martinez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony Francis Martinez in court.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held. Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Douglas Rebholz, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony Francis Martinez appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Ryan Jay Michaels in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Pre-trial conference held. Defendant requests to proceed pro se. Court adjourns the matter for a status of counsel hearing for defendant to appear in person. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 8/26/22. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JS.

Defendant Anthony Francis Martinez in court.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 29.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/24/22 @ 1p
